meanings.definition: A state of being drowsy or sluggish.
meanings.sent1: After a big meal, lethargies set in, making me want to take a nap.
meanings.sent2: The hot weather caused lethargies in the students, making them move slowly.
meanings.sent3: The lethargies of the lazy cat were so extreme that it slept through the entire day.
meanings.sent4: The lethargies of winter seemed to slow down time itself.
meanings.sent5: The lethargies of the sloth were so pronounced that it hardly moved at all.

meanings.definition: A lack of energy or enthusiasm.
meanings.sent1: Her lethargies towards exercise made it hard for her to start a workout routine.
meanings.sent2: The team's lethargies were evident in their lackluster performance during the game.
meanings.sent3: Despite his lethargies, he managed to muster enough energy to finish his work on time.
meanings.sent4: The lethargies of boredom weighed heavily on her spirit.
meanings.sent5: The lethargies of Monday mornings always made it hard for him to get out of bed.

meanings.definition: A condition of prolonged unconsciousness or deep sleep.
meanings.sent1: The patient remained in lethargies after the surgery, slowly waking up.
meanings.sent2: The lethargies of hibernation kept the bear asleep throughout the winter.
meanings.sent3: In the fairy tale, the princess was under a spell of lethargies until true love's kiss woke her.
meanings.sent4: The lethargies of the enchanted sleep seemed unbreakable until the hero's arrival.
meanings.sent5: The lethargies of the deep slumber made it seem like time had stopped for the sleeping beauty.
